Software Description: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the MONSOON campaign. The actors frequently used it in weaponized .pps files exploiting CVE-2014-6352. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) This malware makes use of the legitimate scripting language for Windows GUI automation with the same name.
Mitigation Description: Perform audits or scans of systems, permissions, insecure software, insecure configurations, etc. to identify potential weaknesses.
Application: Check for common UAC bypass weaknesses on Windows systems to be aware of the risk posture and address issues where appropriate.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) attempts to escalate privileges by bypassing User Access Control.

Software Description: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the MONSOON campaign. The actors frequently used it in weaponized .pps files exploiting CVE-2014-6352. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) This malware makes use of the legitimate scripting language for Windows GUI automation with the same name.
Mitigation Description: Enforce binary and application integrity with digital signature verification to prevent untrusted code from executing.
Application: Set PowerShell execution policy to execute only signed scripts.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) downloads a PowerShell script that decodes to a typical shellcode loader.

Mitigation Name: Disable or Remove Feature or Program
Software Description: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the MONSOON campaign. The actors frequently used it in weaponized .pps files exploiting CVE-2014-6352. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) This malware makes use of the legitimate scripting language for Windows GUI automation with the same name.
Mitigation Description: Remove or deny access to unnecessary and potentially vulnerable software to prevent abuse by adversaries.
Application: It may be possible to remove PowerShell from systems when not needed, but a review should be performed to assess the impact to an environment, since it could be in use for many legitimate purposes and administrative functions.\\n\\nDisable/restrict the WinRM Service to help prevent uses of PowerShell for remote execution.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) downloads a PowerShell script that decodes to a typical shellcode loader.

Software Description: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the MONSOON campaign. The actors frequently used it in weaponized .pps files exploiting CVE-2014-6352. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) This malware makes use of the legitimate scripting language for Windows GUI automation with the same name.
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level. Signatures are often for unique indicators within protocols and may be based on the specific obfuscation technique used by a particular adversary or tool, and will likely be different across various malware families and versions. Adversaries will likely change tool C2 signatures over time or construct protocols in such a way as to avoid detection by common defensive tools.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) has sent a C2 response that was base64-encoded.

Software Description: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the MONSOON campaign. The actors frequently used it in weaponized .pps files exploiting CVE-2014-6352. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) This malware makes use of the legitimate scripting language for Windows GUI automation with the same name.
Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to privileged accounts, including SYSTEM and root.
Application: When PowerShell is necessary, restrict PowerShell execution policy to administrators. Be aware that there are methods of bypassing the PowerShell execution policy, depending on environment configuration.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) downloads a PowerShell script that decodes to a typical shellcode loader.

Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to privileged accounts, including SYSTEM and root.
Application: Remove users from the local administrator group on systems.
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) attempts to escalate privileges by bypassing User Access Control.

Mitigation Description: Configure Windows User Account Control to mitigate risk of adversaries obtaining elevated process access.
Application: Although UAC bypass techniques exist, it is still prudent to use the highest enforcement level for UAC when possible and mitigate bypass opportunities that exist with techniques such as [DLL Search Order Hijacking](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1038).
Use: [AutoIt backdoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0129) attempts to escalate privileges by bypassing User Access Control.
